artist: Maruyama Ōzui; Calligraphy by Ōta Nanpo
creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description:
The colophons translate as:
1 (first three lines): “Born in Suruga Province; its land of origin the village of Ōmi. ’Tis the finest mountain in all the world; no other can begin to compare.” 
2 (final four lines): “Even foreigners must come all the way here if they want to see the greatest mountain in the world!”
marks: [生国駿河者本国近江郷　三国一山外出廓出店＊＊] {Shōkoku Suruga wa, hongo [應瑞画] {Ōzui ga}; Calligraphy signed: [蜀山人] {Shokus
title: Mount Fuji
